Definition at line 16 of file NeuralNet.cc.

References dims, init(), and squash.

libpg::NeuralNet::NeuralNet ( Vector &  layerDims,
Vector &  layerSquash 
)

Create a new neural network. Creates params, trace variables (to accumulate gradients) activations and error propogation (delta) variables.

Parameters:
layerDims is a vector that describes the dimension of all layers including input and outputs, in order (el 0 is input layer dim, last el is output dim)
layerSquash is non-zero if the layer should be squashed. Does not work for input dim.

Vector &  output 
) [virtual]

Feedforward stage of the neural network. If you don't know how Neural nets work, don't even bother trying to understand this bit of the code.

void libpg::NeuralNet::feedbackGrad ( Observation &  obs,
Vector &  outputDeltas 
) [virtual]

Do error back propogation, but on the outputDeltas provided rather than on any error

Parameters:
input observation (again)
output deltas, i.e., the gradient of the softmax function. SIDEEFFECT: adds gradients to the trace variables in this class

Implements libpg::Approximator.

void libpg::NeuralNet::dSquashVec ( Vector &  x,
Vector &  v 
)

Compute v*(dy/dx tanh(x)) = v(1 - y^2)

void libpg::NeuralNet::instantStep ( double  reward  )  [virtual]

Step in the direction of the trace*reward. Note that we pre-axpy_prodiply the reward and step size which saves a lot of work over a naive implementation.

Parameters:
reward for this step.

Implements libpg::Approximator.

Implements libpg::Approximator.

Definition at line 311 of file NeuralNet.cc.

References layers, and layerTraces.

void libpg::NeuralNet::resetParams (  )  [virtual]

Set all params to 0. equivalent to a uniform policy. This is a really bad idea for multi-layer perceptrons. For MLPs, use small random values instead, and pray that I've written that function by the time you want to use it.

Implements libpg::Approximator.

Definition at line 325 of file NeuralNet.cc.
